assumptions: 40% cover decline is primarily attributable to competitive entry, not seasonal variation
Food cost at 38% is a structural constraint, not a temporary spike
The operator has at least a small base of returning customers that can be identified
Monthly revenue is sufficient to sustain operations for 60+ days without intervention

interventions.label: Low-capital
interventions.name: Compress the Menu, Own a Time Slot
actions: Reduce lunch menu to 5-7 highest-margin items
Identify one underserved lunch time slot

interventions.label: Structural
interventions.name: Build a Repeat Customer Layer
actions: Launch simple punch card or digital loyalty program
Identify top 20% of covers by frequency
Map what high-frequency customers order and when
Create a standing reason to return specifically for lunch

interventions.label: Defensive
interventions.name: Shift Revenue Mix Away from Lunch
actions: If lunch covers remain depressed after 45 days, pivot kitchen capacity
Identify 3-5 local corporate offices for direct catering outreach
Set 15% catering revenue target within 90 days
interventions.trigger_condition: Lunch cover count fails to recover 15% after 45 days

metrics.name: Revenue per cover
metrics.target: Flat or improving after menu compression

first_irreversible_step.action: Remove the 3 lowest-margin lunch items from the menu
first_irreversible_step.rationale: Only move that immediately improves structural position without spending money or making external commitments

risks.description: Cover decline has additional causes beyond competitive entry (parking, reviews, service issues)
risks.mitigation: Survey returning customers before making menu changes

risks.description: Menu compression may disappoint existing customers expecting prior options
risks.mitigation: Communicate changes directly; highlight what's staying

risks.description: Catering pivot requires operational capacity not currently deployed
risks.mitigation: Do not pursue Track C until Track A shows measurable results

decision_window: 45 days. If lunch cover count has not recovered 15% and food cost has not dropped below 35% by day 45, escalate to Track C.
safety_notes: This plan does not constitute legal or financial advice
Consult a licensed accountant before restructuring cost categories or cash allocation
No revenue projections are guaranteed; all figures are directional
